document.docTitle: Argyresthia (Argyresthia) longalbella Liu, Wang & Li, 2017, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Review of the genus Argyresthia Hübner, [1825] (Lepidoptera: Yponomeutoidea: Argyresthiidae) from China, with descriptions of forty-three new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Review of the genus Argyresthia Hübner, [1825] (Lepidoptera: Yponomeutoidea: Argyresthiidae) from China, with descriptions of forty-three new species

subSubSection.paragraph:
48.
Argyresthia ( Argyresthia ) longalbella
,
sp. nov.
( Figs. 60 , 82 , 126 , 182 , 238 , 284 )

Description. Adult ( Figs. 60 , 82 ) wingspan 10.5̄ 11 mm . Head white, face tinged with yellow. Labial palpus white, tinged with yellow laterally. Antenna with scape white, pecten yellowish fuscous; flagellum grayish white, ringed with black. Foreleg with femur, tibia, and tarsus blackish fuscous on inner surface, yellowish white on outer surface; midleg mostly yellowish white, tibia dorsally dotted with fuscous at base and at middle, blackish fuscous on each tarsomere distally; hindleg mostly white, tibia with distal half blackish gray on outer surface, black on each tarsomere distally. Thorax white; tegula golden orange. Forewing ratio 4.5; ground color rust fuscous, with dense transverse dark fuscous striae becoming denser distally; costa with basal 3/5 pale yellow with blackish-fuscous striae alternating with yellowish white, yellowish-white spot at distal 1/5; wide golden orange streak below basal half of fold; dorsal band white, extending to end of fold, scattered with a few transverse dark fuscous striae, with some scattered pale yellowish-white scales near tornus; cilia dark fuscous to blackish fuscous basally and distally, grayish white medially, yellowish white adjacent to costal spot, gray near tornus. Hindwing and cilia uniformly gray. Abdomen slivery gray dorsally, grayish yellow ventrally.

Male genitalia ( Figs. 126 , 182 , 238 ): Tuba analis slightly shorter than width of valva. Socius covered with 19̄20 scale-like setae, bearing a single long seta posteriorly ( Fig. 238 ). Gnathos not inflated distally, without long thick setae apically. Valva elliptical, widest at basal 3/7; a row of long thick setae from disc near ventral margin to distal area, with setae near apex of ventral margin shorter. Saccus with distal 3/5 narrowed distally. Phallus straight, 4.0 times as long as width of valva ( Fig. 182 ). Second sternite with about 14 micro-setae in each row; eighth sternite Y-shaped. Coremata present.

Female genitalia ( Fig. 284 ): Ovipositor 2.8 times as long as eighth segment. Anterior apophysis 4/5 length of posterior apophysis, bifurcate at middle, branches fused, forming ventral margin of ostium bursae. Lamella postvaginalis nearly rectangular. Antrum funnel-shaped, 2/5 length of eighth segment. Ductus bursae spinulate near and before opening of ductus seminalis; ductus seminalis originating from anterior 2/5 of ductus bursae. Corpus bursae ovate, narrower on anterior half; densely denticulated, becoming sparser anteriorly; signum with basal plate elongate oval, horns uniformly slender, curved inward, C-shaped.

Distribution. China ( Beijing , Hebei , Henan , Gansu , Ningxia , Shanxi , Sichuan ).

Diagnosis. This species is similar to
A . ( A .) albicomella Moriuti, 1969
[ holotype examined], but it differs from the latter in the rust-fuscous forewing with the dorsal band extending to the end of the fold, and in the funnelshaped antrum and the ovate corpus bursae apparently narrower on distal half in the female genitalia. In
A. ( A .) albicomella
the dorsal band on the ferruginous-brown forewing extends to the basal 1/3 of the dorsum, and the antrum is uniform in width and the corpus bursae elliptical in the female genitalia.
Etymology. The specific name is derived from the Latin longus , meaning long, and albus meaning white, referring to the long white dorsal band.
